VEC.Q: How many slices are there in this pie chart?
VEC.A: There are {5} slices in this pie chart.

SRP.Q: In the pie chart, what is the next slice in the clockwise direction from slice Wheat?
SRP.A: The next slice clockwise from slice Wheat is {Corn}.

SRP.Q: In the pie chart, what is the next slice in the counterclockwise direction from slice Wheat?
SRP.A: The next slice counterclockwise from slice Wheat is {Soybeans}.

VPR.Q: Which crop has the largest proportion in this pie chart?
VPR.A: The crop with the largest proportion is {Rice}.

VPR.Q: Which crop has the smallest proportion in this pie chart?
VPR.A: The crop with the smallest proportion is {Barley}.

VE.Q: What is the value of the Corn slice in this pie chart?
VE.A: The value of the Corn slice is {12}%.

VE.A: The value of the Soybeans slice is {25}%.

VE.Q: What is the value of the Wheat slice in this pie chart?
VE.A: The value of the Wheat slice is {25}%.

SC.Q: What is the difference between the values of Corn and Soybeans in this pie chart?
SC.A: The difference between Corn and Soybeans is {13}%.

SC.Q: What is the sum of the values of Wheat and Barley in this pie chart?
SC.A: The sum of Wheat and Barley is {36}%.

NF.Q: Which categories in the pie chart exceed 25.0%? Please list the category names and corresponding percentages.

MSR.Q: How many sectors have a percentage between 5% and 12%?
MSR.A: There are {2} sectors that have a percentage between 5% and 12%.

MSR.Q: Which three sectors have a sum of percentage less than 50%? List all possible combinations.
MSR.A: The possible combinations are: {(Wheat, Corn, Barley), (Soybeans, Corn, Barley)}.
